alert.note: Alert for Foothills of the Blue Mountains of Washington; Lower Slopes of the Eastern Washington Cascades Crest; Northwest Blue Mountains; Simcoe Highlands; Upper Slopes of the Eastern Washington Cascades Crest; Yakima Valley (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued April 25 at 2:08PM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...RISES ON STREAMS AND RIVERS EXPECTED DUE TO SNOWMELT... Streams and rivers emanating from the mountains will see rises the latter half of the week into early next week. A ridge of high pressure building over the Pacific Northwest will lead to a significant increase in temperatures the remainder of the week into the weekend. Given above normal snowpack currently in place over the mountain areas, accelerating snowmelt is expected to lead to rises in streams and rivers with several gauges forecasted to meet bankfull over the weekend into early next week. As of now, flooding is not expected. This Hydrologic Outlook will be updated again Wednesday afternoon in accordance with the latest updates to the forecast.

area.areaDesc: Foothills of the Blue Mountains of Washington; Lower Slopes of the Eastern Washington Cascades Crest; Northwest Blue Mountains; Simcoe Highlands; Upper Slopes of the Eastern Washington Cascades Crest; Yakima Valley
